definition: to hang out together with (derog.)/to mix with
mutually/with one another/manservant/boy servant/guy (derog.)
variant of 廝|厮[si1]
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: Father is annoyed that his daughter consorts with all kinds of strange people.
sentences.chinese: 明的人厮混在一起，父亲很是恼火。

sentences.english: John's mom told him not to get mixed up with the bad kids at school.
sentences.chinese: 约翰的妈妈要他别跟学校里的坏小孩厮混。

sentences.english: He is running with a gang of youngsters.
sentences.chinese: 他正与一帮青少年歹徒厮混在一起。

sentences.english: You have more time for friends.
sentences.chinese: 有更多时间和朋友厮混。

sentences.english: He goes round with a bunch of thugs.
sentences.chinese: 他经常和一帮流氓厮混。

definition: to hang around/to fool around/to live aimlessly
mixed in as part of a community/hiding one's identity/occupying a position while not deserving it
to muddle along/to live aimlessly
a pack of rogues (idiom); a gang of scoundrels
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
to muddle things up/to goof off/to hang around
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
lit. to enjoy the beautiful spring scenery (idiom)/fig. to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
to loiter/to hang around/dissolute/licentious
to idle about
to carry on intimately with (idiom); ardent relationship (esp. between lovers)/billing and cooing
(coll.) all day long/all the time
to loiter
to stir up trouble
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
